Detailed Description

The DirectionCursor object acts as a view target for an object.

It accepts device events and represents its direction based on the update. It is represented as a direction vector from the origin intersecting a point on a sphere centered on the origin.

The origin represents the observer's eyes in local coordinate space. The direction represents the line of sight along observer's view direction.

You can obtain the direction cursor using the BigWorld.dcursor function.

DirectionCursor::DirectionCursor ( DataSectionPtr  rootSection,
SpeedProvider *  speedProvider = NULL,
const Angle &  pitchInRadians = INITIAL_PITCH,
const Angle &  yawInRadians = INITIAL_YAW,
bool  invertVertical = INITIAL_VERTICAL_POLARITY,
float  initialMouseSensitivity = INITIAL_MOUSE_SENSITIVITY,
float  initialMouseHVBias = INITIAL_MOUSE_HV_BIAS,
const Angle &  maxPitchInRadians = INITIAL_MAX_PITCH,
const Angle &  minPitchInRadians = INITIAL_MIN_PITCH,
PyTypeObject *  pType = &s_type_ 
)

The constructor for the DirectionCursor class.

The parameters after the 'section' parameter all have default arguments. These arguments are used as default catch-values should their corresponding values not be found in the resource.

Parameters:
rootSection The Root Section of the configuration file.
speedProvider An object to provide the cursor's speed.
pitchInRadians The pitch angle in radians.
yawInRadians The yaw angle in radians.
invertVertical The flag for vertical movement inversion.
initialMouseSensitivity Mouse sensitivity multiplier.
initialMouseHVBias Mouse horizontal/vertical bias.
maxPitchInRadians The maximum value of the cursor pitch.
minPitchInRadians The minimum value of the cursor pitch.
pType The derived Python object type.

static bool DirectionCursor::Check ( PyObject *  pObject  )  [inline, static]

void DirectionCursor::direction ( const Angle &  pitchInRadians,
const Angle &  yawInRadians 
)

Sets the cursor direction by the yaw and pitch angles.

This method is useful for setting both yaw and pitch values simultaneously. If only one or the other needs to be set, (but not both,) the separate yaw and pitch methods may be used instead. The convention for yaw is: z-axis is the zero angle, with z-axis to x-axis as positive increase.

Parameters:
pitchInRadians The new pitch angle in radians.
yawInRadians The new yaw angle in radians.

const Vector3 & DirectionCursor::direction ( void   )  const

Returns the direction of the cursor represented by the DirectionCursor.

If the old direction is out of date, the direction is recalculated, normalised, and cached before returning it. The convention for yaw is: z-axis is the zero angle, with z-axis to x-axis as positive increase.

Returns:
A normalised 3D vector representing the direction of the DirectionCursor.

void DirectionCursor::forceLookSpring (  ) 

Forces a return to neutral pitch.

PyObject* DirectionCursor::get_py_forceLookSpring (  )  [inline]

PyObject* DirectionCursor::get_py_yawPitch (  )  [inline]

bool DirectionCursor::handleAxisEvent ( const AxisEvent &  event  )  [protected, virtual]

Handles an axis event.

When a joystick is being used, the direction cursor takes all its input from its position every frame instead of using mouse movement events. If the axis is within the dead zone, this function will not be called.

Reimplemented from InputHandler.

bool DirectionCursor::handleKeyEvent ( const KeyEvent &  event  )  [protected, virtual]

Handles a key event.

If there are any key events that would affect the DirectionCursor, they are processed here. A key event is defined as a key or button press, regardless of the device.

Parameters:
event The key event.
Returns:
True, if the event was processed. False, if the event was ignored.

Reimplemented from InputHandler.

bool DirectionCursor::handleMouseEvent ( const MouseEvent &  event  )  [protected, virtual]

Handles a mouse event.

The majority of changes to the DirectionCursor will come from events from positional devices, such as joysticks and mouses.

Parameters:
event The mouse event.
Returns:
True, if the event was processed. False, if the event was ignored.

Reimplemented from InputHandler.

void DirectionCursor::invertVerticalMovement ( bool  flag  ) 

Sets vertical movement to be inverted or not inverted.

Parameters:
flag A boolean flag indicating whether vertical movement is to be inverted or not.

bool DirectionCursor::invertVerticalMovement ( void   )  const

Returns true if vertical movement is inverted.

When vertical movement is inverted, a downward movement will look up and an upward movement will look down.

Returns:
True if vertical movement is inverted. False, otherwise.

void DirectionCursor::lookSpring ( bool  flag  ) 

Sets the flag stating if the direction cursor will decay towards a neutral pitch after a set amount of time.

Parameters:
flag The new setting for the look-spring behaviour.

bool DirectionCursor::lookSpring ( void   )  const

Returns the flag stating if the direction cursor will decay towards a neutral pitch after a set amount of time.

Returns:
A true or false value.

void DirectionCursor::lookSpringOnMove ( bool  flag  ) 

Sets the flag stating if the direction cursor would like to return neutral pitch upon movement of the character.

Parameters:
flag The new setting for the look-spring behaviour.

bool DirectionCursor::lookSpringOnMove ( void   )  const

Returns:
A true or false value.

void DirectionCursor::lookSpringRate ( float  newRate  ) 

Sets the decay value of the look spring movement.

It is a value between 0.0f and 1.0f. A value of 1.0f means no decay towards neutral, while a value of 0.0f means instantaneous movement towards neutral.

Parameters:
newRate The value between 0.0f and 1.0f.

float DirectionCursor::lookSpringRate ( void   )  const

Returns the decay value of the look spring movement.

It is a value between 0.0f and 1.0f. A value of 1.0f means no decay towards neutral, while a value of 0.0f means instantaneous movement towards neutral.

Returns:
The value between 0.0f and 1.0f.

void DirectionCursor::mouseHVBias ( float  newHBias  ) 

Sets the mouse horizontal sensitivity bias.

The value ranges between 0.0 and 1.0, with 0.0 meaning biased fully towards vertical movement, 1.0 meaning fully biased towards horizontal movement, and 0.5 meaning both readings are equal.

Parameters:
newHBias Mouse horizontal bias between 0.0 and 1.0.

float DirectionCursor::mouseHVBias ( void   )  const

Returns the value of the mouse horizontal/vertical bias.

The value ranges between 0.0 and 1.0, with 0.0 meaning biased fully towards vertical movement, 1.0 meaning fully biased towards horizontal movement, and 0.5 meaning both readings are equal.

Returns:
Mouse horizontal sensitivity bias.

void DirectionCursor::mouseSensitivity ( float  newMultiplier  ) 

Sets the multiplier to the mouse readings.

This is a crude mouse movement to angle converter.

Parameters:
newMultiplier The mouse sensitivity multiplier.

void DirectionCursor::yaw ( const Angle &  yawInRadians  ) 

Sets the yaw angle of the cursor direction.

If both pitch and yaw need to be set simultaneously, the direction method may be used instead. The convention for yaw is: z-axis is the zero angle, with z-axis to x-axis as positive increase.

Parameters:
yawInRadians The new yaw angle in radians.

const Angle & DirectionCursor::yaw ( void   )  const

Returns the yaw angle of the cursor direction.

The convention for yaw is: x-axis is the zero angle, with z-axis to x-axis as positive increase.

Returns:
The yaw angle of the cursor in radians.
